channel.title: lebanese on Offline Cook Book
channel.description: Recent content in lebanese on Offline Cook Book

item.title: Zaatar
item.description: This is a traditional Palestinian-Lebanese way of making Zaatar. It can be then eaten by dipping bread in olive oil and in the Zaatar or as part of another recipe. Will hold for a long time in the pantry. This recipe scales for larger amounts so long you preserve the ratios. Ingredients 1 Cup Zaatar leaves (without the stalks), cleaned and dried. 1 Cup sesame (optionally roasted). 1 Cup Sumac.

item.title: Lebanese Lentil Soup
item.description: author: skipper-davies Lebanese-Style Lentil Soup with Swiss Chard and Lemon ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 10 min üç≥ Cook time: 30 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 8 Ingredients 3 cups red lentils 12 cups water 1 large red onion, diced 2 small Yukon gold potatoes, diced 1 medium zucchini, diced 4 cups Swiss chard, chopped 1 bunch of cilantro, chopped ¬º cup of lemon juice, more to taste 1 teaspoon cumin Directions In a large pot, add lentils and water and place on medium heat to boil.
